content: The day we can all recognize that those with emotional, cognitive, or mental issues are NOT slackers / weak-willed / misfits will be a great day for the human race. On any given day, any one of us can have a moment — or a few moments — when we don’t feel quite “right.” I cannot imagine how miserable it must be to have those moments run together for hours or days or weeks, and yet be greeted with some version of “oh, just snap out of it!” Excellent and necessary article, David B. Grinberg — these walls must come down, people must feel free to seek needed help with stigma, and conversations must happen about helping those in pain — of all kinds.
